event.title: the first election for the county seat with Concordia, Clyde and the now

data.event: December 1869 was the first election for the county seat with Concordia, Clyde and the now defunct town Sibley.

event.title: was held between Concordia and Sibley on January 4, 1870

data.event: Without a clear majority, a second election was held between Concordia and Sibley on January 4, 1870.

event.title: a year later when Concordia officially became

data.event: It was over a year later when Concordia officially became a town when the Republican Land District Office opened on January 16, 1871.
It was over a year later when Concordia officially became a town when the Republican Land District Office opened on January 16, 1871.
The Concordia Land Office continued until February 28, 1889 when it was consolidated with the land office in Topeka, Kansas.
